newsitem.title: UK: Gulf Canada wins control of Clyde.
newsitem.headline: Gulf Canada wins control of Clyde.

text.p: Gulf Canada Resources Ltd. Tuesday narrowly won control over Clyde Petroleum Plc, bringing to a close one of the bitterest takeover battles in the oil industry in recent years.
The Canadian firm said it held 51.42 percent of Clyde Petroleum shares after its 494 million pound ($793 million) offer closed at midday.
The acquisition of Clyde gives Gulf Canada a firm base in the North Sea, exposure to Australia and a bigger presence in Indonesia, which already was one of its core areas.
Clyde is the international acquisition Gulf Canada was planning for some time to complement its Canadian and Indonesian operations.
The oil exploration and production sector has seen a flow of takeovers worldwide in the past 18 months and industry analysts say more bids will undoubtedly follow.
After years of cost-cutting to fight depressed oil prices, many oil firms have well-filled war chests to make acquistions to replace or expand oil and gas reserves.
